titleStmt.title: [University of Chicago Library GMS-0275, a manuscript catalogue description in electronic form]
titleStmt.funder: Institute of Museum and Library Services

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center

overview.p: Hymnal (Sharaknots‛) in Armenian. Canons arranged in order of the liturgical year. Musical notation throughout. Formerly Goodspeed Ms. Arm. 66
37 marginal miniatures and 1 full-page miniature paired with canons of the primary text. Marginal vignettes of arabesques, birds, flowers, and temples.

headpieces.p: Headpieces within diamond shaped or circular frames of red, green, blue, and gold floral motifs (fols. 1r, 56v, 109v, 137r, 181r, 228r, 286r, 309r, 336r).

initials.p: Major initials formed by figures of lions or birds (23-25 mm). Minor initials formed by figures of birds or flowers.

physDesc.extent: 359 leaves, of which 2 are raised pastedowns that function as flyleaves. Folio number 232 left out of primary foliation. Leaves initially missed now numbered 136b, 149b, and 159b. Foliation corrected from fol. 323 forward.

foliation.p: 1 (unfoliated parchment flyleaf) + 136 +1 (136b) + 13 + 1 (149b) + 10 +1 (159b) + 195 + 1 (unfoliated parchment flyleaf). Modern foliation in Arabic numerals in ink 1-355. Corrections in pencil.

collation.p: 23 numbered quires. In several places within the manuscript inserted paper or parchment leaves replace the ending of canon texts or are blank (fols. 136b, 227, 285, 308, and 335). Where leaves were excised, images corresponding to the following canons were lost: Holy Easter (fol. 137r); Eve of the Holy Cross (fol. 228r); Whole body of martyrs (fol. 286r); Whole body of those that have died in Christ (fol. 309r); and Resurrection of our Lord Jesus Christ (fol. 336r). It is thought a miniature of the Virgin Mary's birth, now lost, preceded the canon memorializing the event (fol.1r).

layout.p: 1 column, 23 to 24 lines. Frame ruling in ink.

handDesc.p: Written chiefly in bolorgir script in black ink. The first line of text below the two headpieces (fols. 1r, and 137r) are respectively bird letters and ornate capitals. The second and third lines are written in erkat’agir script. Musical notation included.

condition.p: Dirt and water stains. Text rubbed (fols. 343-353).

binding.p: Bound in medium brown leather over boards.

origin.p: The manuscript was written in 1654 (Armenian Era 1103) by the priest Astuacatur at the Church of St. Sergis the General (Surb Sargis Zōravar) in Constantinople, the present-day Istanbul, Turkey (his colophon, fols. 355r-355v).

provenance.p: Later history of the manuscript is unknown. Notation including price (front flyleaf, recto). Inscription and notation (back flyleaf, recto).

acquisition.p: Date acquired by the University of Chicago unknown.

projectDesc.p: The Edgar J. Goodspeed Manuscript Collection contains 68 Greek, Armenian, Latin, Syriac, Ethiopic, and Arabic manuscripts, which range in date from the fifth to the nineteenth century. With support from the Institute of Museum and Library Services National Leadership Grants for Libraries, Building Digital Resources program, the University of Chicago Library has created the online Goodspeed Manuscript Collection, a unique digital resource with manuscripts digitized in their entirety and presented with high-quality zoomable images through an interface that supports browsing within individual manuscripts and across the collection.

Descriptions of the manuscripts have been encoded using the standard set forth in TEI Consortium, eds., TEI P5 Guidelines for Electronic Text Encoding and Interchange: Manuscript Description, at http://www.tei-c.org/release/doc/tei-p5-doc/en/html/MS.html as of 2012-09-22.

The TEI DTD used was obtained from the Digital Scriptorium of Columbia University at, https://www1.columbia.edu/sec/cu/libraries/bts/digital_scriptorium/technical/ds-xml/description_dtd/index.html on 2012-09-22. To accommodate specific project needs, the DTD was edited and extended with local tags in order to describe the content of miniatures, and the structure of canon tables, headpieces, and initials. The process of editing included equating the element Decoration with the seven recognized elements of the TEI Manuscript Description, not only to emphasize intellectual substance, but also to augment visibility by providing links from the record through encoding to the digitized imagery of the Web display.

overview.p: Hymnal (Sharaknots‛) in Armenian. Canons arranged in order of the liturgical year. Musical notation throughout. Formerly Goodspeed Ms. Arm. 66

msItem.summary: Canon of the birth of the Holy Theotokos.
Canon of St. Joakim and St. Anna, parents of the Holy Theotokos.
Canon of the Annunciation to the Holy Theotokos.
Canon of the Eve of Theophany and of Lucernarium.
Canons of the Theophany (first through eighth day).
Hymns of the Magnificat of the Resurrection.
Canon of Candlemas (Penthesis).
Canon of St. Anthony the Great of Egypt.
Canon of Emperor Theodosius the Great.
Canon of St. David the Prophet-king and St. James the Apostle.
Canon of St. Stephen, deacon and Protomartyr.
Canon of St. Peter and St. Paul the Apostles.
Canon of St. James and St. John the Apostles (Sons of Thunder).
Canon of the Holy Apostles and St. Paul. Hymn of the twelve Holy Apostles.
Canon of the Seventy-two Holy Disciples.
Hymn of St. Sergius the General.
Canon of Jonah the Prophet.
Canon of Shrove Tuesday.
Canon of Repentance.
Canons of the Salt and Bread Fast (Lent, second through sixth Sunday). Hymns.
Canon of the Forty Holy Soldier-Martyrs of Sebaste.
Canon of St. Gregory the Illuminator's casting into the pit.
Canon of the Raising of Lazarus.
Canons of Palm Sunday.
Canons of the Great Days of the Week (second though fifth day).
Canon of Great Friday.
Canticle of the Lord Catholicos St. Nersēs the Great (Eve of Great Friday). Song for Great Friday.
Canon of the Great Sabbath of the Lord's burial.
Hymns for the Quinquagesima Mass.
Canon of Holy Easter.
Canon of the Resurrection.
Canon of the Saturday commemorating the beheading of St. John the Baptist.
Canon of the New Sunday. Canons (untitled).
Canon of the Sunday of world shrines. Canons (untitled).
Canon of the Ascension of Christ.
Canon of the second Palm Sunday. Canon (untitled).
Canons of the Pentecost (first through seventh day).
Canon of the birth of St. John the Baptist.
Canon of St. John the Baptist.
Canon of St. Gregory the Illuminator's deliverance from the pit.
Canon of St. Gregory the Illuminator's sons and grandsons, Sts. Aristakes, Vrtanes, Housik, Grigoris, and Daniel.
Canon of St. Nersēs the Great.
Hymn of St. Isaac (Sahak) the Great.
Canon of St. Hřip‛simē and her companions.
Hymn of St. Sanduxt.
Canon of the Holy Tabernacle.
Canon of the Transfiguration (first through third day).
Canon of Shōghakat‛ (Apparition of Holy Etchmiadzin).
Canon of the passing of the Holy Theotokos (first through third day).
Hymn of the Assumption of the Holy Theotokos.
Canon of the Eve of the Holy Cross.
Canon of the Exaltation of the Holy Cross (first through seventh day).
Canon of the Cross of Varak.
Canon of the discovery of the Holy Cross.
Canons of the Holy Prophets and other prophets.
Canon of the Holy Translators.
Canon of St. Michael and St. Gabriel the Archangels, and of all the heavenly host.
Canon of St. James, Bishop of Nisibis.
Canon of the Holy Patriarchs.
Canon of the Children of Bethlehem.
Hymn of St. Ignatius, Bishop of Antioch.
Hymn of St. John Chrysostom.
Hymn of St. Ephrem of Syria.
Hymn of Sts. Eustratius, Auxentius, Eugenius, Orestes, and Martyrius.
Hymn of the 20,000 martyrs.
Hymn of St. Theodore of Amasea (The Warrior).
Hymn of St. Stephen of Oulnia.
Hymn of the blessing of the Holy Chrism.
Hymn of St. Suk‛ias and his companions.
Hymn of St. David of Dwin.
Hymn of St. Vahan of Goght‛n.
Hymn of St. Kryiakos and St. Julita.
Hymn of St. Osgi and his companions.
Hymn of St. Adom and his soldiers.
Hymn of St. Vartan the Warrior and his companions.
Hymn of St. Nicholas, Bishop of Myra.
Hymn of the Sts. Menas, Hermogenes, and Eugraphus.
Hymn of the Seven Vegetarian Hermits.
Hymn of St. Leontius and his companions.
Canticle of the first day of the week, on the mystery of the Creation and Resurrection of Christ.
Songs to follow Psalms.
Songs of the third, sixth, and ninth hours. Song of the eventide hour of peace.
Hymn of donning the vesture.
Hymn for the censing of the Holy Sacrifice.
Canon of the whole body of martyrs. Canons (untitled).
Canon of the whole body of those that have died in Christ. Canons (untitled).
Canon of the Resurrection of our Lord Jesus Christ. Canons (untitled).

overview.p: 37 marginal miniatures and 1 full-page miniature paired with canons of the primary text. Marginal vignettes of arabesques, birds, flowers, and temples.

minItem.minDesc: Anna, Saint: Portrait. Anna, mother of Virgin Mary, stands at left, hand raised.
Virgin Mary: Annunciation. Archangel Gabriel, at left, holds lilies, points to Virgin Mary; she kneels at right with book; dove of Holy Spirit descends from upper left.
Virgin Mary and Christ Child: Enthroned. Virgin Mary seated on throne with Christ Child, feet resting on footstool; domed building, in background.
Shepherd: With sheep. Shepherd stands next to two sheep, crook in hand.
Christ: Baptism. John the Baptist on riverbank at left, baptizes Christ, at center, standing in river; dove of Holy Spirit descends; three angels on bank, at right.
Christ: Presentation. Virgin Mary holds Christ Child, standing under temple dome.
Anthony Abbot, the Great: Portrait. Anthony the Great blesses with right hand, in left holds scroll.
Theodosius I: Portrait. Emperor Theodosius I holds cross in right hand, points to adjacent text.
David: As king and prophet; Apostle, James the Less. David extends hand indicating adjacent text. James the Less stands behind king.
Stephen, Protomartyr: Portrait. Stephen swings censer held in right hand, in left holds model of domed church.
Apostles, Peter and Paul: Portrait. Peter and Paul face one another, a sword raised between them.
Jonah: In Sea Monster. Prophet Jonah emerges from mouth of fish which stands on its tail; large plant, in background.
Adam and Eve: In Garden of Eden. Nude Adam and Eve stand on either side of the tree in garden; snake entwined around tree trunk.
Shepherd: Good. Christ as Good Shepherd, carries sheep upon shoulders.
Martyrdom: Forty Saints. Naked soldiers huddle together on ice within cave; Christ, above center, arms extended, martyrs' crowns before him; domed building, in background.
Gregory the Illuminator: Portrait. Gregory the Illuminator wearing liturgical vestments, right hand raised in blessing, in left, holds book.
Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus. Christ, at left with disciples, right hand raised; Martha and Mary kneel at his feet; Lazarus, at right, stands inside tomb, wrapped in a shroud.
Christ: Entry into Jerusalem. Christ seated on donkey; robe laid out on road next to him; tree in background.
Virgins, Wise: Portrait. Virgins stand together, each holding a lamp.
Christ: Crucifixion. Christ crucified on cross; skull on mound below cross; sun and moon in upper corners.
John Baptist: Head on Charger. Rays of light illuminate head of John the Baptist which lies in a blood-filled charger.
Apostle, Thomas: Incredulity. Christ stands at center, holds cross-top staff with banner, chest bare; Thomas kneels at left, touches wound in Christ's side; domed building, in background.
Pentecost. Dove of the Holy Spirit descends on 12 apostles. Kosmos, lower center, appears as a crowned elder wearing liturgical vestments. He represents all people to whom apostles will preach.
John Baptist: Portrait. John the Baptist dressed in camel hair tunic, holds cross-top staff with banner, right hand raised.
Gregory the Illuminator: Portrait. Gregory the Illuminator wearing liturgical vestments, right hand raised in blessing, in left, holds book.
Nerses the Great: Portrait. Nerses the Great, wearing liturgical vestments, his right hand raised in blessing, in left, holds book.
Christ: Transfiguration. Christ within mandorla, stands on mountain.
Virgin Mary: Portrait. Virgin Mary, left hand raised, right hand extended toward adjacent text.
Virgin Mary: Portrait. Virgin Mary, extends both hands indicating adjacent text.
Cross, True. Crowned figures stand on either side of cross; title on vertical cross-bar.
Prophet: Portrait. Prophet holds open scroll.
Prophet: Portrait. Prophet holds open scroll.
Mesrop, Saint: Portrait. Mesrop holds open scroll.
Angel, Seraph: Portrait. Six-winged seraph holding a flabellum (fan carried in religious ceremonies).
James of Nisibis: Portrait. James of Nisibis wearing liturgical vestments, right hand raised in blessing, in left, holds book.
Saint: Portrait. Saint wearing liturgical vestments, right hand raised in blessing, in left, holds book.
Innocents: Massacre. Soldier holds child in left hand, in right, carries sword; he threatens a woman, her arms raised; slain child lies on ground, center right.
Leontius, Saint: Portrait. Leontius stands, right arm raised in blessing.

listBibl.bibl:
Treasures in heaven: Armenian illuminated manuscripts, edited by Thomas F. Mathews and Roger S. Wieck
(New York: Pierpont Morgan Library; Princeton, N.J.: distributed by Princeton University Press, 1994),
pp. 162-163 (cat. 22).
